subsubsection.title: The Antiderivative
subsubsection.definition:
Antiderivative Antiderivative
A function F is called an antiderivative of f on an interval I if F'(x) = f(x) for all x\in I.

assemblage.title: General Antiderivative vs. Specific Antiderivative
assemblage.p: A general antiderivative takes the form F(x) + C, while a specific antiderivative takes the form F(x). For a specific antiderivative, we must have information about the value(s) of the original function.
